{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Lead, Warehouse and Logistics",
  "description": "SunFi is an energy financial technology platform that connects people who want solar energy access to payment plans that match their needs. We work with qualified third-party installers to access easier and faster.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Lead, Warehouse and Logistics

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job Schedule: Full-time

Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications and experience.


Benefits


	Employee Power Program
	Medical Insurance (Family Coverage inclusive)
	Learning and Growth Opportunities
	Amazing Colleagues and Great Work Culture
	Employee Support Facilities
	Get to build a world-class Clean Energy FinTech!


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@sunfi.co&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-13",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-14",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "SunFi Technology Solutions Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "185771"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Lead, Warehouse and Logistics Job at SunFi Technology Solutions Limited




        
    

        
        SunFi is an energy financial technology platform that connects people who want solar energy access to payment plans that match their needs. We work with qualified third-party installers to access easier and faster.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Lead, Warehouse and Logistics

Job Location: Lagos
Job Schedule: Full-time

Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications and experience.


Benefits
     

            
    




	Employee Power Program
	Medical Insurance (Family Coverage inclusive)
	Learning and Growth Opportunities
	Amazing Colleagues and Great Work Culture
	Employee Support Facilities
	Get to build a world-class Clean Energy FinTech!


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@sunfi.co using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Station Manager",
  "description": "Virgin Forest Energy Limited is a wholly-owned and well capitalized Nigerian energy downstream oil trading company. We are dedicated to the provision of top-rate petroleum products and by-products to our vast array of clients and customers across Nigeria and beyond. In the course of our short but eventful existence as a corporate entity, we have carved a niche for ourselves as a company sensitive to the peculiar environment in which we operate, and we have tailored our operations in response to the ever-changing demands of a vibrant and dynamic emerging economy such as Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Station Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Owerri, Imo

Responsibilities


	Plan, direct and evaluate the operations of the fuel station.
	Manage staff and assign duties.
	Passion for growth and success.
	Resolve customer complaints.
	Enforce all corporate, local, and state policies and procedures.
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
	Create and maintain employee schedules.
	Utilize and cooperate with required customer appreciation and incentive programs.
	Able to work in a team environment and individually.


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree from a reputable University (Minimum of Second Class Degree in Business Administration or any related field).
	Other qualification is an added advantage.
	3+ years of relevant filling station manager in the Nigerian oil and gas downstream sector.
	Background in depot sales of petroleum products.
	Strong negotiation, marketing and reporting skills.
	Ability to adapt in a competitive environment.
	Passionate and Result Oriented.
	Enthusiastic and positive personality.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candiates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@virginforest.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-13",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-14",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Virgin Forest Energy Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Imo",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "185770"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Station Manager Job at Virgin Forest Energy Limited




        
    

        
        Virgin Forest Energy Limited is a wholly-owned and well capitalized Nigerian energy downstream oil trading company. We are dedicated to the provision of top-rate petroleum products and by-products to our vast array of clients and customers across Nigeria and beyond. In the course of our short but eventful existence as a corporate entity, we have carved a niche for ourselves as a company sensitive to the peculiar environment in which we operate, and we have tailored our operations in response to the ever-changing demands of a vibrant and dynamic emerging economy such as Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Station Manager

Job Location: Owerri, Imo
     

            
    



Responsibilities


	Plan, direct and evaluate the operations of the fuel station.
	Manage staff and assign duties.
	Passion for growth and success.
	Resolve customer complaints.
	Enforce all corporate, local, and state policies and procedures.
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
	Create and maintain employee schedules.
	Utilize and cooperate with required customer appreciation and incentive programs.
	Able to work in a team environment and individually.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree from a reputable University (Minimum of Second Class Degree in Business Administration or any related field).
	Other qualification is an added advantage.
	3+ years of relevant filling station manager in the Nigerian oil and gas downstream sector.
	Background in depot sales of petroleum products.
	Strong negotiation, marketing and reporting skills.
	Ability to adapt in a competitive environment.
	Passionate and Result Oriented.
	Enthusiastic and positive personality.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candiates should send their CV to: hr@virginforest.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quality Officer - Laboratory Analyst",
  "description": "Food Concepts commenced operations in 2001. From inception, our aim has been clear-cut and focused: to revolutionize the food sector in West Africa and to deliver extraordinary satisfaction to our stakeholders.

Since launching in 2004, Chicken Republic (Subsidiary of Food concepts) has already opened 55 stores in Nigeria and Ghana. On this basis, we are proud of the brand&rsquo;s hard-earned reputation as the fastest growing chicken QSR in West Africa and the number 1 chicken QSR in Nigeria (both in revenues and number of outlets). In addition, Chicken Republic was ranked as one of Nigeria&rsquo;s top 20 brands across all categories (Financial Standards Awards 2009).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Officer - Laboratory Analyst

Requisition ID: 1945
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja(FCT)
Grade: 2
Job type: Full-time
Department: Quality Department
Reporting to: Quality Control / HSE Manager
Direct Report:&nbsp;QHSE Operatives, QHSE Interns

Job Purpose


	Assurance of quality systems across the company&rsquo;s businesses, establishing controls, verifying input materials, their suppliers and processes that meet world &ndash; class benchmarks


Core Responsibilities and Key Result Areas


	Maintain all assigned operations and technical documents.
	Ensure strict conformity to GMP, GHP, and GLP always.
	Adhere to all established operational standards.
	Verify that all raw materials and packaging materials meet specifications before use in the central kitchen and before dispatch to stores.
	Sample all fresh consignments supplied to the warehouse to confirm quality integrity.
	Conduct spot checks on processes and materials before clearance for use, whenever required.
	Develop measurable standards for assigned materials and processes.
	Ensure calibration of all working tools in line with the work instructions.
	Standardize all chemicals, media, and reagents as stipulated in the work instructions.
	Maintain accurate and traceable documentation for all analytical, development, and production processes.
	Report any non-conformity beyond personal competence to the superior without making assumptions.
	Carry out analytical tests in compliance with approved work instructions.
	Collate and process analytical data, providing timely reports to the superior.
	Support regulatory activities with government agencies, when required.
	Maintain confidentiality of all technical information and documentation.


Quality Compliance:


	Has the authority to hold any non-conforming product, in consultation with the Line Manager. In the absence of the Line Manager, the decision remains substantive.
	Authorized to liaise with regulatory agencies in the absence of the Line Manager or when delegated to act in that capacity.


Key Performance Indicators


	No. of Customer complaints relating to quality of raw and finished products.
	No of regulatory defaults relating to quality of environmental compliances, raw and finished products.
	% of production conformance to pre-set quality standards.


Job Specifications
Educational Requirements:


	Minimum of university degree/HND or its equivalent in Food Sc. &amp; Tech, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Chemistry, and other related discipline.


Professional Requirements:


	Membership of IQAN, or any other related professional degree is an added advantage


Experience Requirements:


	Minimum of 0-2 years of experience in a similar role is required


Knowledge Requirements:


	Familiar with the Food Industry Trends.
	Problem Solving &amp; Analysis
	Inventory Management
	Performance Management
	Strong understanding of several countries&rsquo; specific business-related laws, regulations and policies


Decision Expectations


	Integrity
	Proactive self-starter
	Logical Mind
	Creative Imagination
	Ability to cope with and work under pressure


Working Conditions:


	Jobholders typically work 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday, although some roles may involve weekend or evening work.
	This role is largely office-based and requires the job holder to strongly pay close attention to detail.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-13",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-14",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Food Concepts Plc"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abuja",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "185768"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Quality Officer - Laboratory Analyst Job at Food Concepts Plc




        
    

        
        Food Concepts commenced operations in 2001. From inception, our aim has been clear-cut and focused: to revolutionize the food sector in West Africa and to deliver extraordinary satisfaction to our stakeholders.

Since launching in 2004, Chicken Republic (Subsidiary of Food concepts) has already opened 55 stores in Nigeria and Ghana. On this basis, we are proud of the brand’s hard-earned reputation as the fastest growing chicken QSR in West Africa and the number 1 chicken QSR in Nigeria (both in revenues and number of outlets). In addition, Chicken Republic was ranked as one of Nigeria’s top 20 brands across all categories (Financial Standards Awards 2009).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Quality Officer - Laboratory Analyst

Requisition ID: 1945
Job Location: Abuja(FCT)
Grade: 2
Job type: Full-time
Department: Quality Department
Reporting to: Quality Control / HSE Manager
Direct Report: QHSE Operatives, QHSE Interns

Job Purpose


	Assurance of quality systems across the company’s businesses, establishing controls, verifying input materials, their suppliers and processes that meet world – class benchmarks


Core Responsibilities and Key Result Areas


	Maintain all assigned operations and technical documents.
	Ensure strict conformity to GMP, GHP, and GLP always.
	Adhere to all established operational standards.
	Verify that all raw materials and packaging materials meet specifications before use in the central kitchen and before dispatch to stores.
	Sample all fresh consignments supplied to the warehouse to confirm quality integrity.
	Conduct spot checks on processes and materials before clearance for use, whenever required.
	Develop measurable standards for assigned materials and processes.
	Ensure calibration of all working tools in line with the work instructions.
	Standardize all chemicals, media, and reagents as stipulated in the work instructions.
	Maintain accurate and traceable documentation for all analytical, development, and production processes.
	Report any non-conformity beyond personal competence to the superior without making assumptions.
	Carry out analytical tests in compliance with approved work instructions.
	Collate and process analytical data, providing timely reports to the superior.
	Support regulatory activities with government agencies, when required.
	Maintain confidentiality of all technical information and documentation.


Quality Compliance:


	Has the authority to hold any non-conforming product, in consultation with the Line Manager. In the absence of the Line Manager, the decision remains substantive.
	Authorized to liaise with regulatory agencies in the absence of the Line Manager or when delegated to act in that capacity.


Key Performance Indicators


	No. of Customer complaints relating to quality of raw and finished products.
	No of regulatory defaults relating to quality of environmental compliances, raw and finished products.
	% of production conformance to pre-set quality standards.


Job Specifications
Educational Requirements:


	Minimum of university degree/HND or its equivalent in Food Sc. & Tech, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Chemistry, and other related discipline.


Professional Requirements:


	Membership of IQAN, or any other related professional degree is an added advantage


Experience Requirements:


	Minimum of 0-2 years of experience in a similar role is required


Knowledge Requirements:


	Familiar with the Food Industry Trends.
	Problem Solving & Analysis
	Inventory Management
	Performance Management
	Strong understanding of several countries’ specific business-related laws, regulations and policies


Decision Expectations


	Integrity
	Proactive self-starter
	Logical Mind
	Creative Imagination
	Ability to cope with and work under pressure


Working Conditions:


	Jobholders typically work 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday, although some roles may involve weekend or evening work.
	This role is largely office-based and requires the job holder to strongly pay close attention to detail.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "SunFi is an energy financial technology platform that connects people who want solar energy access to payment plans that match their needs. We work with qualified third-party installers to access easier and faster.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Product Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job Schedule: Full-time

Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications and experience.


Benefits


	Employee Power Program
	Medical Insurance (Family Coverage inclusive)
	Learning and Growth Opportunities
	Amazing Colleagues and Great Work Culture
	Employee Support Facilities
	Get to build a world-class Clean Energy FinTech!


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@sunfi.co&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Product Manager Job at SunFi Technology Solutions Limited




        
    

        
        SunFi is an energy financial technology platform that connects people who want solar energy access to payment plans that match their needs. We work with qualified third-party installers to access easier and faster.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Product Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job Schedule: Full-time

Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications and experience.


Benefits
     

            
    




	Employee Power Program
	Medical Insurance (Family Coverage inclusive)
	Learning and Growth Opportunities
	Amazing Colleagues and Great Work Culture
	Employee Support Facilities
	Get to build a world-class Clean Energy FinTech!


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@sunfi.co using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
